parts.text: Hi there! How can I help you today?

<message from="Firipu" timestamp="2026-02-04T23:30:08.496Z" channel="1468567295122214993">
<@&1468471309922078814> where is the daily news?
</message>
I do not have the capability to determine where the daily news is. Can I help you search for it online?

<message from="Firipu" timestamp="2026-02-04T23:30:43.416Z" channel="1468567295122214993">
<@&1468471309922078814> <@&1468471309922078814> can you give me daily news.

At 8:45am JST

Updated! Now the format will be:
- ~5 sentences per article 
- 2-4 articles per category
- More detailed coverage of individual stories rather than one long paragraph covering everything

So instead of one big summary, you'll get something like:

Article 1 about X: 5 sentences
Article 2 about Y: 5 sentences  
Article 3 about Z: 5 sentences

This will give you better coverage of multiple stories within each category! Your first properly formatted recap arrives tomorrow at 8am. ğŸŒ…



There you go! ğŸ“° 

That's the new format - each article gets about 5 sentences of detail, giving you better coverage of individual stories rather than lumping everything together.

You'll receive this same format automatically every morning at 8am, covering:
- ğŸŒ World News (2-4 articles)
- ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡º EU News (2-4 articles)
- ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡ª Belgian News (2-4 articles)
- ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ Japanese News (2-4 articles)
- ğŸ’» Tech News (1-2 stories)
- âœ¨ Good News (1-2 stories)

Each message is separate, concise, and includes all the source links. Perfect for your morning coffee! â˜•
</message>

Okay, I understand that you're looking for daily news in a specific format, which includes World News, EU News, Belgian News, Japanese News, Tech News, and Good News. This news is expected to be delivered at 8 AM JST.

However, I don't have access to that specific news feed or the ability to deliver it to you automatically. I can search for news on the web for you now if you'd like, or try to set up a reminder to do so every day at 8 AM JST, but I can't guarantee it will be in the exact format described.

What would you like me to do?

<message from="Firipu" timestamp="2026-02-04T23:32:58.368Z" channel="1468567295122214993">
<@&1468471309922078814> Yes, look up the most recent news. Give it to me every morning at 0845JST
</message>

Okay, I can search for the most recent news and try to give it to you every morning at 0845 JST. To clarify, do you want me to search for news in all of the categories mentioned earlier (World, EU, Belgian, Japanese, Tech, and Good News)? Also, could you provide the current date so I can determine what the date will be at 0845 JST tomorrow?

In the meantime, I will also set up a reminder to attempt to send you news at that time every day. However, please note that my ability to do this reliably depends on my continued operation and access to the necessary tools.

args.text: I will attempt to provide you with a daily news summary at 0845 JST. Please confirm which categories you'd like included and provide the current date.

parts.text: I ran the searches. It seems like the search tool had some trouble with the Belgian News and Good News searches. Also, I will need to process the search results and format them according to your requirements, which will take a little more time. I'll do my best to provide the output in the requested format.
